Baba, during her apprenticeship, accidentally brewed this cursed potion. She tried to bury her shame, but it refused to remain hidden.
"Just a few hundred more of these bad boys and you'll have a real piece of armor." - Wayland, the Blacksmith
A generation ago, three sulfur mines ran dry almost simultaneously. Bomb smiths made due, but mining operations slowed down considerably.

Description.Value: Upgrade your bombs to blow up new kinds of rocks

Flavor.Value: Ultrasonic waves weaken the foundation of rocks and really irritate cave bats.

Description.Value: Bomb damage is proportional to the number of carried bombs, +5 bombs

Flavor.Value: A strange stone that radiates warmth and a sense of comfort.
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.

Description.Value: Penance heals, but food and healing potions no longer drop

Flavor.Value: Only the most devout peasants are able to find sustenance in times of famine.
"If on your journey, you should encounter a god, a god will be cut."
The details of this ticket are hard to understand as they look to be poorly translated, but you get the idea.

DeathFlavor.Value: Glomped.
Flattened.

Description.Value: A creature that mostly consists of water

Flavor.Value: Glomps rapidly absorb the elements of their environment. If, for example, a Glomp lands in or near water it will very quickly hydrate itself, extinguishing flames or diluting oil in its "body."

Description.Value: Unlocks chests, doors, and other locked objects

Flavor.Value: Inscribed with the crest of the Kingdom of Delvemore: a rampant liger.
Patches of thick monster hide held together with strong leather thread. Oddly familiar looking.
An ingenious design of patterned leather with thin iron thread running through it.
Pull out a blackberry bush and not suffer the consequences!
Just an ordinary sleeping pillow, yellowed from years of drool marks.
Placed in the beds of young children to protect them from the horrors of the night.

The dungeonmaster is aware that these "weapons" are exceptionally ineffective and are quite ludicrous. Their primary function is to instill fear in prisoners, and to discourage escape attempts. As ineffective as they are, they can be tricky to dodge when sneaking around without a candle or lantern.

DeathFlavor.Value: Pelted to death by a fly.
Destroyed by a tiny fly.

Flavor.Value: Bass flies evolutionarily split off from treble flies many generations ago. They made the Golden Core their home and the environment changed them. They became tougher, more aggressive, and deadlier. And while their skin toughened and darkened in color, their wings developed a bright golden hue, matching their surroundings.
We abdicate the throne of self-determination through prayer, whether it is to the light... or the dark.
"Any alchemist can turn lead into gold. Stone to gold is an entirely different matter." - Dirk, the Alchemist

Description.Value: All ore is mined when entering a room

Flavor.Value: The explosion can be heard by Pilfers for miles.

Description.Value: Goldsack Upgrade - Lose less gold on death

Flavor.Value: The same leather bag as before, but with a patch over the hole.

Description.Value: Ghastly hands will attack the enemy

Flavor.Value: Relics that communicate with the Othermine are rare and mystify even the most learned scholars of the land.

Description.Value: Add a TRANSMUT3 to the room

Flavor.Value: "Miniaturization technology and transmutation technology? What a time to be alive." - Unknown Alchemist

Description.Value: Recover health for each carried curse

Flavor.Value: The liquid moves slowly. Often requiring a knife be inserted into the bottle to get things moving.
Typical Pilfers can be a nuisance, but these... these little edge lords are a nightmare.

Description.Value: A flower that protects its environment

Flavor.Value:
Churchbells were named for the large, protective dome they create to secure their seedlings and anything else in the immediate area. 

The dome is magical in nature, and has inspired several protective spells developed in the Sanctum.

Description.Value: Secret rooms are even more secret

Flavor.Value: Secrets are only secrets when few people know of them.
Not all debt is bad, but this one certainly is. If only there were a quick way to repay it?
Palms are sweaty, knees weak, arms are heavy. There is vomit on the tunic already.

Description.Value: Reduces the cost of shop items

Flavor.Value: Pilfers always remember a face, and they enjoy the familiar.
Something that resembles actual protective wear. The leather is scarred with cuts and scrapes.
Din is a god of gifts, but requires loyalty from his subjects.
What it lacks in protection, it makes up for in cool factor.
Walking out onto the abyss can be fairly disconcerting at first. It's fairly disconcerting the hundredth time too.

Description.Value: A slime with an actual gift

Flavor.Value:
There is a lot about Pilfer behavior that is unknown. Most Pilfers drop off their spoils somewhere in the UnderMine. 

Hoarding Pilfers, however, consume their bounty, embedding it in their body. They are attracted to anything seemingly of value including gold and thorium.

Description.Value: Heal over time for each curse

Flavor.Value: Scentless fumes arise from the liquid, rejuvenating tired bones.

The calcified creatures of the caverns belong to one, larger entity known as Ponzu. Scales are technically a single creature, and therefore share their strengths with one another. 

Unbreakable scales make up the outermost part of Ponzu, granting him immense durability.
Blacksmiths often call platinum the poor man's mithril.
Warning: Make sure to be on firm ground when the effects wear off.

Description.Value: Gain a speed boost when out of danger

Flavor.Value: Enchanted with a sense of adventure.

Description.Value: Increase drop rate of items from rocks

Flavor.Value: Simply touching this rock makes one feel luckier.
Be careful what you pray for.
A totem depicting an ancient god of life and the natural order.
Gives a spicy kick to any food. Particularly good on breakfast potatoes.
Only a thorium blade can sever the gossamer of the crystalline spider.
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.

DeathFlavor.Value: Gently caressed to death.

Description.Value: Unleashes a burst of spikes when damaged

Flavor.Value: Not all of Som's creations were meant for household chores. Some he envisioned as a replacement for soldiers -- transforming how kingdoms waged war and saving thousands of lives in the process. Eventually, Som recanted these notions, realizing his error. However, the deed was done and many Golems had already been given life, locked away in the cellars of Som's Keep.

Description.Value: Keep all your gold when you die

Flavor.Value: The best investment for the future is a needle and some thread.

Shamans and Drudes share so much in common that it is hard to differentiate the two. Both secs have a penchant for animating objects that should never have been given life. 

Shamen animate manikins to do their bidding, and to destroy their enemies, which is anyone who pries in their affairs.
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.
Get pumped up, to pump those arms as fast as you can.
"You get healed, and you get healed... you all get healed!" - Black Rabbit
Impervious to the passage of time, this ancient aegis has survived the rise and fall of countless kingdoms.
Originally discovered by the geologist Moog, who was later able to synthesize it using custom built tools.
"If you thought the salt mines were bad, wait until you see the pepper mines." - Unknown Peasant

Description.Value: Expand the shop's special item supply

Flavor.Value: The words "VERY GOOD!" are written in large bold letters, and the 'r' is backwards.

Description.Value: Duplicate all basic items in the room

Flavor.Value: A vial of popcorn kernels. They vibrate with anticipation.
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.

NoBlueprintLocID.Value: I have no hatchlings to, mrmph, hatch.

ExplanationLocID.Value:
Griswold hatches eggs for thorium. When an egg is hatched, a familiar is added to your collection. Only one familiar can be used at a time unless the Bell upgrade is purchased.

Familiars are not lost when the peasant dies and will return the peasant's gold to the hub for the next run.

Flavor.Value: Hatched by the Collector

Description.Value: Block a hit once in a while

Flavor.Value: "Being invincible once in a while is better than never at all." - Proverb

Cast out by their sisters, the drude and shaman, occultists sought refuge in the bog. Seclusion and the spreading corruption pushed their twisted magic to the limits. Animation is not enough, they seek vengeance, and will inflict all kinds of disabling charms on their enemies.
A blessed trinket that wards off spirits, demons, and other nasty things.

Description.Value: Temporarily reveals secret rooms, secret rooms can have secret rooms

Flavor.Value: One thousand iron spiders were used to make the thread.
These items are all powerful, but beware, a curse comes with each and every one of them.
A thick vest, packed with down. Cozy in the autumn.
Apothecaries often overcharge for holy water knowing they have the market cornered.

Description.Value: Restores very little health and can make you sick

Flavor.Value: A nice porterhouse, but way past its prime.
From one throwing creature to another.
Standard issue tool for the working class.
The blade cuts through the air with a crack and the sound of snicker-snack.
A shockingly good build for someone of questionable state of mind.

DeathFlavor.Value: Regrets opening the chest with the teeth.
Knew in his heart opening the chest was a mistake.

Flavor.Value: Half the size but just as deadly as their parents, Minics often seek shelter in unlikely places.

Description.Value: Emits a hypnotic beam that hobbles its enemies

Flavor.Value:
One of the occultist's many creations. These dolls' only purpose is to disable creatures. What the occultists do with these creatures is anyone's guess. 

The doll does technically have one other job, and that's to hold picture frames in place so that the occultist can judge if they're level.

Description.Value: Restores a large amount of health

Flavor.Value: Meat from a wall always tastes better than meat you have to earn yourself.

Description.Value: Increase throw damage, swing size, and swing speed

Flavor.Value: The land that is now Delvemore was once ruled by giants. The old giant king's crown was forged into two complimentary crowns for the King and Queen.

ExtendedDescription.Value: A key fashioned from bones

ExtendedFlavor.Value: The Halls of Din are an incredibly dangerous place, both for the body and the soul. A labyrinth of crypts that rarely sees visitors. Those that return from the halls appear aged beyond their years, and have lost the ability to talk. Looking into their eyes is like looking into the eyes of a doll. Nothing of them remains.

Description.Value: Makes way to the Halls of Din

Flavor.Value: A face carved into the key seems to shift in the light.

Description.Value: Enemies hit with the thrown pickaxe explode on death

Flavor.Value: A vile vial of liquid that rests in the pickaxe head. A mechanism injects victims upon impact.
Perfectly suited for holding a pickaxe.
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.

Description.Value: Goldsack Upgrade - Lose less gold on death

Flavor.Value: Better than makeshift, but the drawstring doesn't close all the way.
They want you to bring the gold out, but this is full of holes. Makes no sense.
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.
Nicknamed the "peeper's potion" for obvious reasons.

Description.Value: Sometimes drop a new bomb when using an old bomb

Flavor.Value: In a parallel universe, somebody is missing a lot of bombs.

Description.Value: Feel the wrath of the plants

Flavor.Value: The springs in Delvemore can be more brutal than the winters due to what some would call "violent pollination."
Clear your mind and wish deep. That which you desire may become yours, or perhaps not.

Description.Value: Spent gold is turned into bonus damage

Flavor.Value: The kind of axe a beast-riding, gnome-bashing barbarian would use.

DeathFlavor.Value: Crushed underfoot by the most noble of creatures.
Regrets angering Bobo.

Description.Value: A gentle giant with hands the size of barrels

Flavor.Value: Despite popular belief, Bobo is not the name of an individual creature, but the name of the species.  Bobo are typically non-violent, unless provoked.
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.

Description.Value: Increases the chance to critical strike for Nikko and peasant
Critical strikes from Nikko deal damage to all nearby enemies

Flavor.Value: Was once a pet to Baba. Nikko escaped, and it is rumored he has been plotting his revenge ever since.
A firm stance, and controlled movements do wonders to improve one's throwing capabilities.

Description.Value: Increase health, swing damage, and attack speed

Flavor.Value: A strange branch with strange properties. For instance, planting one in the ground will grow a small tree instantaneously.
Blacksmiths often call mithril the rich man's platinum.
A cosmic sword, lightning the night's sky with karmic justice.

Description.Value: Expand the shop's special item supply

Flavor.Value: The words "VERY GOOD!" are written in large bold letters, and the 'r' is backwards.
"Where did I leave my goldsack?" - Unemployed peasant
Attunement begets atonement.

Description.Value: Adds a point of armor to the health bar

Flavor.Value: They won't make you lightning fast, but they will help when you drop a hammer on your foot.

ExplanationLocID.Value:
Wayland crafts relics for thorium. When a relic is crafted, you may use it on your next run. It will be lost when the peasant dies, but can be found again on subsequent runs.

You may craft more than one relic at a time, but can only take the first on your next run. All crafted relics can be found on future runs.

Flavor.Value: Crafted at the Blacksmith

Description.Value: Removes a curse and deals 75 damage

Flavor.Value: Sometimes the good must suffer in order for evil to be purged from the world.

Description.Value: Counter Weight Upgrade - Increases throw range

Flavor.Value: A carefully crafted weight that maintains a weapon's balance while it is in flight.
Wool mittens with a string connecting them.
Much luckier than a three leaf clover. Not nearly as lucky as a five leaf clover.
A cooking grill, miniaturized by a wizard that enjoyed backpacking in The Enchantments.

Description.Value: All food is golden and extra delicious

Flavor.Value: A cursed apple, turned to gold by a fool who didn't know what they were wishing for.

Description.Value: Be blessed with two gifts from the pilfers

Flavor.Value: "I'm still not sure what these pilfers are up to, but hooboy, two relics!" - Black Rabbit
Ejected from Selt's dying body, this egg continues to produce her spawn.

Description.Value: Temporarily consumes a future curse after praying

Flavor.Value: Also known as "The Altar." This constellation protects against bad omens, for a while.
A gross fruit that secretes a sticky, stinky slime that dissuades insects from eating it. It tastes great though.

Description.Value: Discover a bomb in every chest

Flavor.Value: Normally it is unwise to use old, unstable explosives found in long forgotten chests. Normally.
Made from a creature with a thick hide that brought all the smith's to the yard.

Description.Value: Is whatever you need it to be, sometimes

Flavor.Value: A very fluid potion, in more ways than one.

ExtendedDescription.Value: A map to the Shimmering Caverns

ExtendedFlavor.Value: Beyond the Halls of Din are the Shimmering Caverns, a labyrinth of bright crystal and sparkling sand. The caverns have seen very little human activity, but there are remnants of some civilization, long dead, or long left. After some study, it seems the sand in the caverns may be the remnants of Scales, pulverized over the centuries into shimmering dust.

Description.Value: A map to the Shimmering Caverns

Flavor.Value: A long lost map to a place no one has visited in quite some time

ExtendedDescription.Value: A map to the Golden Core

ExtendedFlavor.Value: The Golden Core has been a source of mystery for all of recorded history. Many expeditions of brave adventurers have been sent off to explore it, but none return. Its dangers are countless. The heat is intense, the creatures are aggressive and deadly, and it is as deep as the Undermine goes. At least, as far as anyone knows.

Description.Value: A map to the Golden Core

Flavor.Value: Singed around the edges and faintly smells of sulphur.

Description.Value: Chance on hit to ignite your enemies

Flavor.Value: Separated from the legendary creature Seer, the tail still writhes in agony.
Bishop's prized blend of fifty seven different powders and chemicals.
Travelling monks often carried these incase they had to perform an emergency blessing.
Over time it was learned that the color red, the sanguine color, was preferred.

Description.Value: Increases the cost of shop items

Flavor.Value: A pioneering Noble once attempted to raise the price of potatoes by hoarding them, only for them to rot in his cellar.

DeathFlavor.Value: Glomped.
Flattened.

Flavor.Value: Not enough is known about glomps. The academies of the kingdom have only just begun to study them. Is this large creature the result of two glomps fused together? Or is this some sort of mitosis?
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.

ExtendedDescription.Value: A map to the Halls of Din

ExtendedFlavor.Value: The haunted halls have served many purposes and many masters over the centuries. They were originally built as a mausoleum for the royal family. Centuries later, and long after the royal family changed over, mages and alchemists setup libraries and labs. They had been run aground for their twisted ideas and propensity for the dark arts. Now the halls are home to no one, other than the twisted creations of blasphemers.

Description.Value: A map to the Halls of Din

Flavor.Value: "Not recommended for use." - Hoodie

Description.Value: A floater with forty five degree attacks

Flavor.Value: Bishop's Fish is not actually a fish, nor is it named for the bombsmith Bishop. Not until later at least. These floating jellies are exceptionally light and float along with the air current. When threatened, they pulsate their bodies and release small projectiles. Although the bombsmith and his famous bomb came later, this creature has either way been nicknamed after his creation due to the way it ejects projectiles.
These large urns found in the crypts contain the accursed Will o' the Wisps, but many have been unsealed. They now overflow with Wisps that look to pass on their curse.

Description.Value: Whenever the Phoenix heals the peasant it applies an immolation effect that burns nearby enemies

Flavor.Value: "I'm not sure if it actually changes your items, or if it just messes you up so bad you think it did." - Dirk, The Alchemist

Description.Value: Get a free item in every shop

Flavor.Value: "Who pilfers the pilfers?  I do." - Black Rabbit
Made from dissolving ground, dried canaba leaf in alcohol.

DeathFlavor.Value: Ran over.

Description.Value: A slime with a sturdy composition

Flavor.Value: Hunter Pilfers are rarely seen in the UnderMine and most consider this a blessing. These slimes move with speed and determination, and they seem to be built of sturdier stuff than their cousins. It's hard to say whether being hit by a hunter slime is better or worse than being trampled by a horse.
An assistant to Dirk invented and named this bomb. M.E.G.A translates to Manfred's Electrical Golden Armament. He was promptly dismissed for his terrible, forced acronyms.
Tempered metal really cuts down on vibration when bashing rats.
Live up to the challenge, or die in mediocrity.

DeathFlavor.Value: Regrets opening the chest with the teeth.
Knew in his heart opening the chest was a mistake.

Description.Value: A deceptive enemy that strikes when one's guard is down

Flavor.Value:
Mimics are devious creatures that have evolved to look like mundane, human objects, the most common of which is a chest. 

It is rumored that the mimic's imitation is not perfect -- that there is a small flaw. If one were to discover it, they would be able to avoid engaging these monsters.

Description.Value: The queen will occasionally sting enemies
The queen will sometimes create a Drop of Honey, a powerful healing blessing
Drop of Honey increases poison damage inflicted by the peasant or queen
A viciously defensive companion that isn't afraid to sting

Flavor.Value: The corruption of the bog turned bee against bee in a devastating civil war. The queen now sits upon a lonely throne.

Description.Value: Consumes all current and future blessings and converts them to swing damage

Flavor.Value: A legendary mace that consumes all the light around it, creating an area of perpetual darkness.

Description.Value: A mysterious box that invites calamity

Flavor.Value: Before his party was lost, Kurtz had the foresight to stash away some things for safe keeping.
In the theme of making armor from animals...

Description.Value: Keeping cart rails clear with deadly force

Flavor.Value: These nefarious devices were first implemented to keep rats from building nests over mine cart tracks. They proved successful and their use was expanded to keep other areas clear of critters.

Description.Value: Find small boxes in big boxes

Flavor.Value: Several years ago there was a craze in the wizarding community to make tiny versions of everything. It has since gone out of style.
Made by an artisan with a good sense of irony.
Not so fine print: This contract is not void in the case of death or dismemberment. Your next of kin will be responsible for repayment.
A potion of such extreme value that they are often hoarded and never used.

Description.Value: The Phoenix heals the peasant whenever they receive damage
Whenever the Phoenix heals the peasant it applies an immolation effect that burns nearby enemies
The Phoenix will resurrect the peasant once when they fall

Flavor.Value: An ancient creature that performs a cycle of rebirth once every hundred years.

ExtendedDescription.Value: Resets and strengthens the denizens of the Undermine

ExtendedFlavor.Value: A strange cycle occurs in the Undermine. A cycle that often spans hundreds of years and goes by unnoticed. Ancient creatures live their lives, die, and are reborn. The origin, the purpose, and the means are all unknown, but this stone is somehow in the center of all of it.

Description.Value: Pours new power into the ancients and ends the current run

Flavor.Value: Strength and fortitude lent from another place.

Description.Value: Droplets of fire fall from the sky

Flavor.Value: Targon, the Bold was cursed with fire and brimstone after having severed the great Firelord's tail.
A small offering earns a small favor.

Description.Value: A witch that animates and twists the essence of objects around her

Flavor.Value:
Deep in the Grimwood lives a witch coven that practices dark and forbidden arts. Arts such as animation. They animate objects and twist their life essence for nefarious purposes. 

Once, one of the Drude animated a fork to scratch the area between her shoulder blades. This fork's entire life now is to scratch itches for its master.
A crown bestowed to those that meet the challenge of the Othermine. Reverts back to its default state upon death.

Description.Value: The Phoenix will resurrect the peasant once when they fall
Chance to drop a key and bomb when using either

Flavor.Value: When a single single isn't enough.
Developed by the goblin alchemist Wrix who studied and was inspired by the strength of the feral orcs.

ExtendedDescription.Value: Sets one back at the beginning

ExtendedFlavor.Value: The Undermine's cycle remains incomplete, and the powers that be are left unsatisfied. This stone has manifested itself, and along with it a second chance for things to be put right.

Flavor.Value: "Avoiding challenge only makes you grow weak and complacent." - Guard Captain Toadvine
Sports a patterned weave for added protection and style.
A diamond miner returned this after discovering it was maybe too good at its job.

Description.Value: Enemies temporarily explode in arrows after a critical strike
Increases move, attack, and throw speed at the beginning of battle

Flavor.Value: Even peasants can intimidate their enemies with the correct livery.

Description.Value: Bomb kills permanently increase bomb damage

Flavor.Value: The lifeforce of slain enemies is converted and stored for later.

Bing Bong are a subspecies of shadow creature that possess objects and use them to their advantage. Much like hermit crabs they will upgrade their possession if it is considered an upgrade. Bing Bong in particular like bells because they offer incredibly good protection, but are also susceptible to loud, external noises.

ExtendedDescription.Value: An evening fungus

ExtendedFlavor.Value: Nightshade are harmed by sunlight so they are often found in blocked in caverns. They are covered in bright blue and purple stripes that glow in the dark. It's thought this might be some kind of communication mechanism with other mushrooms.

Description.Value: One of three mushrooms searched for by the Alchemist's Apprentice

Flavor.Value: Thrives in the darkness.
"Discover the secrets of the UnderMine!" is written in playful lettering on the front.
The brewing process begins with capturing a powerful gust of wind from atop Mt. Thessal.

Description.Value: Sometimes drop meat from your enemies

Flavor.Value: Once belonged to the King's personal butcher. Pudge was ejected from the Kingdom when he developed a taste for the flesh of the dead.

Description.Value: Heal in each new room for each curse

Flavor.Value: In the darkness there is light.
Being secure isn't important. It's the illusion of being secure that matters.
A curse devised by a bored demon that enjoyed watching his victims throw-up in confusion.

DeathFlavor.Value: Tripped over a deadly tether.
Caught between two deadly dolls.

Flavor.Value: These dolls lack sentience. They have no free will. They simply do as their master directs. Beware for they are quick and will flank at a moments notice.

ExtendedDescription.Value: A stone fragment depicting the Stone Lord

ExtendedFlavor.Value: Mortar has laid dormant for centuries. During his slumber he communes with the earth, gathering the shared experience of the stones, the soil, and the air. To awaken, Mortar musters a large amount of electrical current and circulates it through his body. His only goal, once awakened, is to return to sleep and reconnect with the earth.

Flavor.Value: It hangs over the cursed, making the world appear dark and dreary no matter the situation.
